intro: Taraxacum boreum, commonly known as the Arctic dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant produces a yellow flower that develops into a white, fluffy seed head, typical of the dandelion genus. It thrives in cold, open environments and is often found in tundra and alpine meadows. Taraxacum boreum is adapted to withstand harsh winters and has a short growing season.
